title: How to fix CORS error in React and Node.js?
description: I am getting a CORS policy error while sending API requests from my React frontend to my Node backend. How can I resolve this issue?
solutions: Enable CORS in backend using the cors npm package.
Set correct origin header inside your CORS middleware.
Use a proxy in React during development instead of hitting backend directly.

title: Difference between let, var and const in JavaScript
description: I am confused about variable declarations in JavaScript. Can someone clearly explain the difference between let, var, and const?
solutions: var is function scoped, let/const are block scoped.
const cannot be reassigned, let can be.
var gets hoisted with undefined, let/const get temporal dead zone.

title: How to perform CRUD operations in MongoDB using Mongoose?
description: I want an example of how to create, read, update, and delete documents in MongoDB using Mongoose in Node.js.
solutions: Use Model.create() to insert a document.
Use Model.find() or findById() to retrieve documents.
Use findByIdAndUpdate() and findByIdAndDelete() for modifying and deleting.

title: What is the useEffect dependency array in React?
description: I see that useEffect has an optional array argument. What is its purpose and how does it affect component re-rendering?
solutions: Empty array runs the effect only once on mount.
Adding variables triggers effect when they change.
Omitting array makes it run after every render.

title: How to optimize SQL queries for faster performance?
description: My SQL queries are slow when dealing with large data. What are some techniques to optimize SQL performance?
solutions: Create indexes on frequently searched columns.
Avoid SELECT *, use specific columns instead.
Use joins properly and avoid unnecessary subqueries.

title: How to center a div using CSS flexbox?
description: I want to place a div exactly at the center of the page using CSS. How can I achieve this using flexbox?
solutions: Use display: flex with justify-content and align-items center.
Give height: 100vh to parent for perfect vertical centering.
Use margin: auto when width is set.

title: Difference between == and === in JavaScript
description: What is the main difference between double equals and triple equals? When should I use each one?
solutions: == compares after type conversion.
=== compares without converting types.
Always prefer === to avoid unexpected results.

title: How to deploy a React app to Vercel?
description: I want to deploy my React project to Vercel. Can anyone explain the steps involved?
solutions: Push your project to GitHub and connect it to Vercel.
Let Vercel auto-detect React and build automatically.
Configure environment variables in Vercel dashboard if needed.

title: What is JWT authentication and how does it work?
description: I'm trying to secure my Node.js backend. How exactly does JWT authentication work and how do I implement it?
solutions: JWT stores user identity in signed tokens.
Backend verifies token using secret key.
Send token in Authorization header for protected routes.

title: How to solve 404 page not found error in React Router?
description: I'm using React Router v6 and getting a 404 error when refreshing a page. How do I fix this?
solutions: Configure catch-all route in your router setup.
Add rewrite rule in Vercel or Netlify.
Ensure your server returns index.html for all paths.

title: How to remove duplicates from an array in JavaScript?
description: I want a simple way to remove duplicate values from an array in JavaScript.
solutions: Use new Set(array) to remove duplicates.
Use filter + indexOf logic.
Use reduce to track seen values.

title: What is the difference between REST and GraphQL?
description: Can someone explain how GraphQL differs from REST and when to use which API style?
solutions: REST has multiple endpoints, GraphQL has a single endpoint.
GraphQL allows querying only required fields.
Use GraphQL for complex data relationships.

title: How to fix memory leak warning in React?
description: React shows a warning about memory leaks when updating state on an unmounted component. How do I resolve this?
solutions: Clear subscriptions or timeouts in cleanup function.
Stop state updates after component unmount.
Use abort controller to cancel async fetches.

title: How to create a responsive navbar using CSS?
description: I want to build a fully responsive navbar using only HTML and CSS. Any sample code?
solutions: Use flexbox for layout and media queries for responsiveness.
Use hamburger icon for small screens.
Hide and show links using CSS transitions.

title: How to connect Django backend with React frontend?
description: I am trying to build a full-stack application. How do I connect my Django backend API with React?
solutions: Use Django REST Framework to build API.
Consume API using Axios or fetch in React.
Configure CORS properly between frontend and backend.

title: How to use async and await in JavaScript?
description: I want to understand async/await syntax and how it simplifies working with promises.
solutions: Mark function as async and use await inside it.
Await pauses execution until promise resolves.
Use try/catch to handle async errors.

title: What is the virtual DOM in React?
description: People often say that React is fast because of the virtual DOM. How exactly does it work?
solutions: Virtual DOM is an in-memory representation of UI.
React compares virtual DOM with real DOM (diffing).
Only changed parts of UI are updated (reconciliation).

title: How to hash passwords in Node.js using bcrypt?
description: I want to store passwords securely. How do I hash passwords using bcrypt?
solutions: Use bcrypt.hash() with salt rounds.
Always store only hashed password, not raw password.
Use bcrypt.compare() to validate during login.

title: How to fetch data using Axios in React?
description: I want to fetch data from an API when the component loads. How do I use Axios inside useEffect?
solutions: Call Axios inside useEffect with empty dependency.
Store result in state using useState.
Handle loading and error states properly.

title: How to fix ERR_MODULE_NOT_FOUND in Node.js ES Modules?
description: I'm using ES Modules and Node shows ERR_MODULE_NOT_FOUND. How do I fix imports and paths?
solutions: Use correct file extensions (.js, .mjs).
Enable type: "module" in package.json.
Use absolute or relative import paths correctly.
